intro: Downingia bicornuta var. montana, commonly known as the mountain Downingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in alpine or subalpine habitats. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its arid environment. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in rock gardens.
